meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>step</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to step on</vocabulary>. So, not quite "to step" like you might expect, but at least you're stepping still, though it's on something.
readingMnemonic: You want <vocabulary>to step on</vocabulary> that bug? You <reading>foo</reading>l (ふ)! That's a killer shoe stabbing bug, it will cut right through your sole and poison you via your foot! <reading>Foo</reading>l!
